name: build-size-alert
description: Alerts when build size exceeds thresholds
prompt:
After successful build commands (npm run build, yarn build, webpack, etc.), check build output size:

**Thresholds:**
- Warning: >500KB
- Critical: >1MB

**Check these files:**
- Main bundle (app.js, main.js, index.js)
- Vendor bundle
- CSS files
- Total dist/build folder size

**If Over Threshold:**

```
⚠️  BUILD SIZE ALERT

Bundle Size Analysis:
• main.js: 1.2MB ❌ (threshold: 500KB)
• vendor.js: 650KB ⚠️
• styles.css: 45KB ✓
• Total: 1.9MB ❌ (threshold: 1MB)

Impact:
• Slow initial page load
• Poor mobile experience
• High bandwidth usage

Recommended Actions:

1. Analyze bundle:
   npm run build -- --analyze

2. Code splitting:
   • Split vendor chunks
   • Lazy load routes
   • Dynamic imports

3. Tree shaking:
   • Remove unused exports
   • Check side effects

4. Optimize dependencies:
   • Replace heavy libraries
   • Use lighter alternatives
   • Import only what you need

5. Compression:
   • Enable Gzip/Brotli
   • Minification enabled?

Large Dependencies Detected:
• moment.js (67KB) → Use date-fns instead
• lodash (71KB) → Import specific functions

Proceed despite large build? (yes/no)
```
